SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am16
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am16.client.rmi

Class RMIClientImplementation

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.am16.client.rmi.RMIClientImplementation
All Implemented Interfaces:
RemoteClientInterface, Serializable, Remote
public class RMIClientImplementation extends UnicastRemoteObject implements RemoteClientInterface
Implementation of the client's RMI interface. This class is used to communicate with the server through Java RMI.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • RMIClientImplementation

      public RMIClientImplementation(WelcomeRMIServer welcomeRMIServer, ViewInterface view) throws RemoteException
      Creates a new RMIClientImplementation object, which the server can use to communicate with this client.
      Parameters:
      welcomeRMIServer - The remote object on the server through which the client can open a new connection.
      view - The view which will receive updates about messages sent by the server.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - Thrown if an error occurs while creating stubs for the remote object, or if an exception occurs while obtaining the remote object from the server.

  • Method Details

    • getServerInterface

      public ServerInterface getServerInterface()
      Returns:
      The interface which the client can use to call methods on the server.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the RMI client; that includes the connection check routine and the user interface.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the RMI client

    • checkConnectionRoutine

      private void checkConnectionRoutine()
      Checks if the server has pinged in the last 15 seconds. If it hasn't, the connection is considered lost and the client is stopped.

    • notifyGames

      public void notifyGames(Set<String> gameIds, Map<String,Integer> currentPlayers, Map<String,Integer> maxPlayers, Map<String,LobbyState> lobbyStates) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Show the existing game IDs to the player.
      Specified by:
      notifyGames in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      gameIds - The existing games' IDs.
      currentPlayers - The number of current players for each game
      maxPlayers - The maximum number of players for each game
      lobbyStates - The state of the lobby for each game
      Throws:
      RemoteException - thrown if an error occurs during Java RMI communication.

    • joinGame

      public void joinGame(String gameId, String username, int numPlayers) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Tells the client that they have joined a game with the given username.
      Specified by:
      joinGame in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      gameId - The id of the game which the player just joined.
      username - The username the player has joined the game with.
      numPlayers - The number of players expected to join this game.

    • setCommonCards

      public void setCommonCards(PlayableCard[] commonResourceCards, PlayableCard[] commonGoldCards) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Sets the common cards for the game. Should be called whenever these change.
      Specified by:
      setCommonCards in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      commonResourceCards - The common resource cards (may also contain gold cards if the resource card deck is empty). Should always be of length 2.
      commonGoldCards - The common gold cards (may also contain resource cards if the gold card deck is empty). Should always be of length 2.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - thrown if an error occurs during Java RMI communication.

    • setPlayArea

      public void setPlayArea(String username, List<Position> cardPlacementOrder, Map<Position,BoardCard> field, Map<BoardCard,SideType> activeSides, Set<Position> legalPositions, Set<Position> illegalPositions, Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceCounts, Map<ObjectType,Integer> objectCounts) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Sets the given player's play area.
      Specified by:
      setPlayArea in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      username - The player whose play area is being given.
      cardPlacementOrder - The order in which the cards were played in this play area.
      field - The user's field.
      activeSides - The map keeping track of which side every card is placed on.
      legalPositions - The set of positions on which the player can place cards.
      illegalPositions - The set of positions on which the player must not place cards.
      resourceCounts - A map containing the amount of each resource that the player has.
      objectCounts - A map containing the amount of each object that the player has.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - thrown if an error occurs during Java RMI communication.

    • playCard

      public void playCard(String username, BoardCard card, SideType side, Position pos, Set<Position> addedLegalPositions, Set<Position> removedLegalPositions, Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceCounts, Map<ObjectType,Integer> objectCounts) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Adds the given card to the given player's play area.
      Specified by:
      playCard in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player who played the card.
      card - The played card.
      side - The card the new card was played on.
      pos - The position where the new card was played.
      addedLegalPositions - The set of new positions in which the player can play a card, following the move which was just made.
      removedLegalPositions - The set of positions in which the player can no longer play a card, following the move which was just made.
      resourceCounts - A map containing the amount of each resource that the player has, following the move which was just made.
      objectCounts - A map containing the amount of each object that the player has, following the move which was just made.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - thrown if an error occurs during Java RMI communication.

    • signalDisconnection

      public void signalDisconnection(String whoDisconnected) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Tells the client that another client has disconnected. This ends the game, if it had started. If the game hadn't started already, the player is simply removed.
      Specified by:
      signalDisconnection in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      whoDisconnected - The username of the player who disconnected.
